attachmentHtml:
PC Number: 2003-1050

Date: 2003-07-15

                     Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Foreign Affairs, pursuant to Vote No. 1 (Foreign Affairs) of Appropriation Act No. 2, 2003-2004, hereby appoints:

 

Alexandra Bugailiskis as Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Canada to the Republic of Cuba;

 

Lorenz Friedlaender as Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Canada to the Kingdom of Sweden;

 

Laurette Glasgow as Consul General of Canada in the Principality of Monaco, with residence in Paris as Minister;

 

Louis Guay as Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Canada to the Gabonese Republic;

 

John T. Holmes as Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Canada to the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan;

 

Jean-Pierre Juneau as Ambassador and Permanent Representative of Canada to the North Atlantic Council;

 

Bruce Jutzi as Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Canada to the Czech Republic;

 

Richard Kohler as Consul General of Canada at Sydney (Commonwealth of Australia);

 

Suzanne Laporte as Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Canada to the Federative Republic of Brazil;

 

Randolph Mank as Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Canada to the Republic of Indonesia;






.../2


- 2 -


 

Paul Meyer as Alternate Permanent Representative and Ambassador of Canada to the Office of the United Nations, and Permanent Representative and Ambassador to the United Nations for Disarmament;

 

Malcolm McKechnie as Consul General of Canada at Atlanta (United States of America);

 

Richard Têtu as Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Canada to the Republic of Iceland;

 

Claudio Valle as High Commissioner for Canada in Jamaica, with concurrent accreditation to Belize;

 

Christopher Westdal as Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Canada to the Russian Federation; and

 

Shelley Whiting as Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Canada to Bosnia and Herzegovina.
